articles.title: DPRK FM Spokesman Urges Panamanian Authorities Let Apprehended Crewmen, Ship of DPRK Leave
articles.content:
DPRK FM Spokesman Urges Panamanian Authorities Let Apprehended Crewmen, Ship of DPRK Leave
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA on Wednesday as regards the case of the DPRK trading ship Chongchongang apprehended in Panama:
					 There occurred an abnormal case in which the DPRK trading ship Chongchongang was apprehended by the Panamanian investigation authorities on suspicion of "drug transport," a fiction, before passing through Panama canal after leaving Havana Port recently.
					
					 The Panamanian investigation authorities rashly attacked and detained the captain and crewmen of the ship on the plea of "drug investigation" and searched its cargo but did not discover any drug. Yet, they are justifying their violent action, taking issue with other kind of cargo aboard the ship.
					
					 This cargo is nothing but aging weapons which are to send back to Cuba after overhauling them according to a legitimate contract.
					
					 The Panamanian authorities should take a step to let the apprehended crewmen and ship leave without delay.

articles.title: Fourth Round of Working Talks between Authorities of North and South of Korea Held
articles.content:
Fourth Round of Working Talks between Authorities of North and South of Korea Held
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- The fourth round of working talks between the authorities of the north and the south of Korea were held in the Kaesong Industrial Zone on Wednesday to normalize the operation in the zone.
					 At the talks the north side advanced sincere and practical proposals for normalizing the operation in the zone at an early date and developing it. They included the issue of refraining from all political and military acts of hindering the normal operation in the zone, the issue of preventing the reoccurrence of suspension of operation, the issue of building institution and mechanism for fully ensuring secure operation and business in the zone, the issue of ensuring personal safety and protecting investment and properties, the issue of passage, communications and customs and the issue of developing the zone into a zone for economic cooperation with international competitiveness.
					
					 But the south side took such very dishonest and insincere attitude as creating artificial hurdles in settling the issues, insisting only on the blame for the crisis in the zone and unilateral assurances against reoccurrence.
					
					 The south side claimed it has the stand of normalizing the operation in the zone but came out to the talks without any draft agreement, the basis of negotiations. It only pretended to have the talks and keep them going on, thus making them fruitless.
					
					 The talks ended without fruit due to the unreasonable assertions and insincere attitude despite the north side's sincere efforts.
					
					 Both sides agreed to hold the fifth round of working talks in the zone on July 22.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Advisor to Mongolian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Advisor to Mongolian President
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with Lundeg Purevsuren, national security and foreign policy advisor to the president of Mongolia, and his party who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.
					 The advisor hoped that the Korean people would achieve greater success in the building of a thriving socialist nation and in the efforts to achieve the country's reunification under the wise leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Advisor to Mongolian President
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Advisor to Mongolian President
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a gift from Lundeg Purevsuren, national security and foreign policy advisor to the president of Mongolia.
					 The advisor handed the gift to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Wednesday.

articles.title: DPRK Led by Kim Jong Un Will Prosper
articles.content:
DPRK Led by Kim Jong Un Will Prosper
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Papers of the DPRK on Wednesday dedicate editorials to the first anniversary of the title of Marshal of the DPRK awarded to the dear respected Kim Jong Un. 
					 Rodong Sinmun says that the awarding of the title of Marshal of the DPRK to Kim Jong Un is an expression of absolute trust and loyalty of all the service personnel and people to him.
					
					 It is the greatest exploit during the last one year that he implemented the cause of perpetuating the memory of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il at the highest level. 
					
					 Statues of the Generalissimos have been erected on Mansu Hill and in different parts of the country thanks to the profound loyalty and a high sense of moral obligation of Kim Jong Un and his energetic activities. Meanwhile, modeling whole society on Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism has been dynamically pushed forward and all the people have worked hard to carry out the behests of the Generalissimos. 
					
					 It is also one of his great exploits that he victoriously led the anti-U.S. struggle and firmly defended the dignity and sovereignty of the DPRK under the banner of Songun. 
					
					 Kim Jong Un's one-year-long journey of Songun is associated with his resolute spirit of anti-imperialist struggle, high spirit to annihilate the enemy and outstanding military strategy and wisdom. 
					
					 Another exploit during the one year is that he ushered in a new heyday in all fields of the revolution and construction while leading people to create a heroic speed for great advance. 
					
					 In fact, the last one year marked a sacred course in which the DPRK advanced by dint of his idea and won a series of victories with his mettle. It was also a grand course in which all the service personnel and people made great achievements by fully displaying their mental power under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Minju Joson says that holding him in high esteem as Marshal of the DPRK is an expression of the boundless loyalty and confidence of all the army and people of the DPRK in the great Songun commander and their will to accomplish under his Songun leadership the revolutionary cause of Juche started on Mt. Paektu.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Decries U.S. Mid-east Policy Aimed to Dominate World
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Decries U.S. Mid-east Policy Aimed to Dominate World
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- This year, U.S. high-ranking officials have frequented to the Mid-east region. U.S. President Obama visited the region as the first thing after starting another term of his office and the new secretaries of State and Defense also flew to the region. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in an article in this regard:
					
					 This reveals the U.S. impatient mind and sinister intention to realize the ambition to dominate the world.
					
					 If the U.S. fails to put the region under its control, it can not contain strategic competitive rivals nor realize its ambition to dominate the world. 
					
					 The U.S. has stretched out its tentacles to the Mid-east region for decades as part of the moves to realize the domination.
					
					 It put much effort into the region, notably the ignition of wars in it. According to the plan touted by the U.S., the region should have already been brought under control. But the situation turned out to be different.
					
					 The Mid-east region placed the U.S. in an awkward position.
					
					 Iran's peaceful nuclear activities have been strengthened and war "against terrorism" started by the U.S. has triggered off the vicious cycle of terror and retaliation.
					
					 Israel carried out an air raid on Syria and has continuously expanded the construction of Jewish settlements in the land of Palestine in a provocative way, deteriorating the regional situation.
					
					 There is clear reason that the U.S. pays deep attention to the issue of the Mid-east region this year. Israel used to disturb the stability of the region at the instigation of the U.S.
					
					 If the U.S. fails to check Israel, the situation in the Mid-east region will lead to a catastrophe phase, provoking a backlash to the U.S. which patronized Israel.
					
					 The U.S. is persistently interfering in the Mid-east issue and steadily inciting Israel while working hard to realize the strategy to dominate the Asia-Pacific region. This indicates Washington's internal trouble.
					
					 Endless is the U.S. greed for hegemony.

articles.title: European Parliament Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
European Parliament Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- The delegation for relations with the Korean Peninsula of the European Parliament led by Chairman Herbert Reul visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Being briefed on the fact that the President was born in a thatched house and spent his childhood, cultivating his strong will for revolution, the members of the delegation looked round the historic relics preserved there with much care.
					
					 They also visited the historic sites on Mangyong Hill.
					
					 The head of the delegation said that the visit to Mangyongdae offered an opportunity to know well about the history of Korea, adding that he could deeply feel the Korean people's reverence for the President.
					
					 The delegation also visited the Academy of Koryo Medicine and Panmunjom.

articles.title: National Fine Art Exhibition Opens to Celebrate War Victory Day
articles.content:
National Fine Art Exhibition Opens to Celebrate War Victory Day 
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- The national fine art exhibition was opened with due ceremony at the Korean Art Gallery on Wednesday to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War. 
					 On display in the center of the venue of the exhibition is an oil painting "On Road of Advance" depicting the great Generalissimo Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 Displayed there are at least 150 art pieces, including Korean paintings, oil paintings and posters. 
					
					 Korean painting "Invincible and Iron-willed Commander Kim Il Sung Commanding the Battle on Height 1211" and other works impressively deal with the undying exploits he performed for the victory in the war. 
					
					 Korean painting "Great Succession to Songun Revolutionary Leadership", acryl painting "Personally Making His Way through Thorny Bushes on the Forefront" and others depict leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 There are also oil paintings "Standing on Guard" and "First Colors" and others deal with the feats and personality of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk. 
					
					 Oil paintings "For Motherland" and "River Rakdong in Flames", Korean painting "Women of Namgang Village" and others depict the brave soldiers of the Korean People's Army and people who displayed popular heroism and matchless bravery in the Fatherland Liberation War. 
					
					 Posters "Korean People Will Surely Win Victory", "Let Us Keep Ourselves Highly Alerted with Juche-oriented Viewpoint on War!" and others deal with the resolution of all the service personnel and people to eternally glorify the revolutionary exploits performed by the Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, build a socialist thriving nation and win a final victory in the struggle to defend the country and build a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Kim Ki Nam, officials concerned, artists and Pyongyang citizens.

articles.title: National Photo Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
National Photo Exhibition Opens
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- A national photo exhibition was opened with due ceremony at the Grand People's Study House Wednesday  to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Displayed in the exhibition are at least 200 photos.
					
					 They deal with the exploits President Kim Il Sung performed by leading the war to victory and the Songun revolutionary feats leader Kim Jong Il performed by turning the DPRK into a political and military power and a full-fledged nuclear weapons state and eternally glorifying the history of the victory in the war. 
					
					 On display are photos showing the personality of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un as a great man who is wisely leading the showdown with the U.S. and the drive for building a thriving nation.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Kim Ki Nam, Yang Hyong Sop, officials concerned and other people in the city.

articles.title: DPRK Foreign Minister Meets New Rwandan Ambassador
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Minister Meets New Rwandan Ambassador
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun met and had a talk with Francois Xavier Ngarambe, Rwandan ambassador to the DPRK, who paid a courtesy call on him on Wednesday.

articles.title: Foreign Diplomats Visit Various Places
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Visit Various Places
						
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Diplomatic envoys of different countries, representatives of international organizations, staff members of foreign embassies and missions here visited the Pyongyang Essential Foodstuff Factory Wednesday on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 They paid tribute to the mosaic depicting President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il standing in the compound.
					
					 In the room dedicated to the history of the factory, they watched a video after being briefed on the leadership feats performed by the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu for the development of the factory.
					
					 They looked round various places of the factory.
					
					 Vietnamese Ambassador to the DPRK Le Quang Ba said that the dear respected Kim Jong Un made sure that the modern factory contributed to improving the people's living standard.
					
					  On the same day, the guests visited the Pyongyang International Football School and Rungna People's Sports Park.
					
					 They made entries in the visitor's book.
					
					 Egyptian Ambassador Iman Mostafa Abdou Ahmed wrote that he came to know well that Kim Jong Un is directing great efforts to the development of physical culture and sports of the country.
					
					 Chief of the Economic Cooperation Bureau of Libya Muhammad Mustafa wrote that Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il devoted all their lives to the people. Kim Jong Un is paying deep attention to improving the people's living standard and developing   the country's physical culture and sports, true to the behests of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, he added.

articles.title: Construction of Ski Resort Progresses Apace in DPRK
articles.content:
Construction of Ski Resort Progresses Apace in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Soldier-builders are pushing ahead with the construction of a ski resort on Masik Pass in the DPRK to carry it out in a short span of time. 
					 Some days ago, they finished the laying of all skiing courses more than 1 000 meters high. The ten skiing courses are classified for professional and amateur skiers.
					
					 The builders introduced rational working methods to the project as they have to simultaneously carry out the construction of dwelling houses and the laying of cableway.
					
					 Meanwhile, they are stepping up the construction of gatepost of skiing ground, skiing apparatuses storehouse and hotel at the fast tempo. 
					
					 More than 20 construction projects are being stepped up all together, some of them going on at the finishing stage.

articles.title: DPRK Hit by Downpour
articles.content:
DPRK Hit by Downpour
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Heavy rains swept through the DPRK from July 9 to 16.
					 According to data available, it rained during the days 518 mm in Kwangwon Province, 483 mm in South Phyongan Province, 428 mm in Pyongyang City, 359 mm in North Hwanghae Province, 328 mm in Nampho City, 257 mm in South Hwanghae Province, 253 mm in North Phyongan Province, 189 mm in South Hamgyong Province and 137 mm in Jagang Province.
					
					 In particular, from 21:00 Sunday to 24:00 Tuesday, 344 mm rainfall was recorded in Anju City, 280 mm in Mundok County, 253 mm in Kaechon City, 243 mm in Nyongbyon County, 242 mm in Pakchon County, 239 mm in Sepho County, 231 mm in Tongchang County, 219 mm in Unjon County, 207 mm in Chonma County and 202 mm in Sinyang County. 
					
					 The torrential rain caused flood damage in various areas, leaving four people dead and one missing from 18:00 of July 13 to 18:00 of July 15.
					
					 More than 180 dwelling houses were destroyed or submerged across the country.
					
					 820 odd hectares of croplands were inundated in North Hwanghae Province while many roads and bridges were damaged in Songchon, Yangdok, Pongsan and other counties.

articles.title: Climate Change Gets Serious in Korea
articles.content:
Climate Change Gets Serious in Korea
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- The Hydro-meteorological Service of the DPRK comprehensively studied and analyzed the climate change for the past five years to predict the climate change for the upcoming five years.
					 According to it, the climate change in Korea has been characterized by the increase in temperature and rainfall as well as typhoon, torrential rain, flood, drought and biting cold causing devastating damage.
					
					 The yearly average temperature for the past five years was 8.5 degrees Celsius, 0.3 degrees rise from the average year.
					
					 Over the 20th century the average global temperature rose by the average of 0.074 degrees Celsius for every decade. In Korea the yearly average temperature rise of 0.2 degrees Celsius was recorded, 2.7 times that of the worldwide rate.
					
					 Precipitation increased also as a result of torrential rain.
					
					 During the years under survey, the record of maximum rainfall was reset in several regions and those regions with almost no record of downpour also suffered.
					
					 In July and August last year more than 400 mm rain fell in two days in Anju-Kaechon area and 274 mm rain in one day in Hochon-Komdok area which rarely saw downpour in the past, causing severe damage.
					
					 The intensity of typhoon has escalated.
					
					 Typhoon 15 which swept across Korea last year had the central atmospheric pressure of 910hPa and the maximum wind speed was 50 m/s. When it reached the area north of 40 degrees north latitude, the central atmospheric pressure reached 975hPa and the maximum wind speed 28 m/s, causing big damage to almost all areas of the country.
					
					 Bitter cold persisted in the winter time.
					
					 The long spell of cold that persisted for 38 days from December 24, 2010 to January 30, 2011, recording temperature 10 degrees lower than the average, was the second longest in the period under survey and the one that hit the country for 21 days in 2009 and 2012 each was the third longest in the period.
					
					 It is expected that warming will persist for five years from 2013 to 2017.
					
					 According to data available, the concentration of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere is expected to rise about 0.004% in 2020 from the present 0.039 percent and the average global temperature to rise 0.6-0.7 degrees Celsius higher than the average year.
					
					 This will affect Korea, causing the average yearly temperature rise of 0.5 degrees Celsius at present to reach 9 degrees Celsius in 2017.
					
					 The global warming is likely to increase the danger from disastrous climate change such as flood accompanied by torrential rain, typhoon and tidal flood in the future, too.

articles.title: Delegation of Korean Youth and Students in Japan Meets with Former Unconverted Long-term Prisoner
articles.content:
Delegation of Korean Youth and Students in Japan Meets with Former Unconverted Long-term Prisoner
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- The delegation of Korean youth and  students in Japan headed by Kim Tu Sop, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Youth League in Japan, met with Choe Thae Guk, a former unconverted long-term prisoner, on Wednesday.
					 Choe said he could remain true to his revolutionary faith and principle despite enemies' harsh treatment behind bars in south Korea for decades because he had profound trust in the peerlessly great persons.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il put forward former unconverted long-term prisoners as heroes of the DPRK and winners of National Reunification Prize, Choe noted.
					
					 He called on youngsters of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) to prepare themselves to be patriots remaining loyal to the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 An art performance was given by former unconverted long-term prisoners and their families and members of the delegation at the meeting.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Leads Korean War to Victory (4)
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised for Feats for War Victory
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Personages in Nepal and Myanmar made public statements on July 10 and 12 with the approach of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Manju Ratna Sakya, chairman of the Nepal Journalist Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Politics, praised President Kim Il Sung as a peerlessly brilliant commander who beat back two imperialisms in one generation.
					
					 The President brought about a great victory startling the world with his outstanding strategy and tactics by dealing telling blows to the U.S. imperialists and their satellite forces, he noted, and went on:
					
					 The U.S. troops present in south Korea under the helmet of "UN Forces" should be withdrawn from the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The Armistice Agreement ought to be replaced by a peace treaty to ensure the lasting peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula, and countries concerned should help the Korean nation reunify the country peacefully with its own efforts.
					
					 He urged the U.S. to retract all the unreasonable measures taken against the DPRK.
					
					 Tin Tun, director of the Myanmar Medical Research Institute, said he came to recollect once again the undying exploits and services rendered by the President on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of Koreans' victory in the war.
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un, a reliable successor to the cause of Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il, is wisely leading the party, army and people to building a thriving nation and achieving national reunification, the director said.
					
					 He extended full support and solidarity to the Korean people in their efforts to build a thriving nation and reunify the country.

articles.title: S. Korean Social Bodies Demand Thorough Investigation into Project for Four Big Rivers
articles.content:
S. Korean Social Bodies Demand Thorough Investigation into Project for Four Big Rivers
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- The All-people Measure Committee for Restoring Four Big Rivers, the Committee for the Investigation into the Project for Improving Four Big Rivers and other civic and social bodies of south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on Tuesday demanding a thoroughgoing investigation into the whole process of the project.
					 The bodies at the press conference recalled that the results of the investigation conducted by the Board of Audit and Inspection on July 10 revealed that the project was a charade aimed to deceive the people as it was pushed forward for the purpose of building a great canal.
					
					 They said the results, however, failed to fully disclose the ecological destruction caused by the project and the damage done to farmers in its process and that the persons and institutions that decided on the wrong policy and implemented it were not called into question at all.
					
					 They called for including members of civic and social bodies in the investigation team.

articles.title: S. Korean Court Hit for Its Base Repressive Action
articles.content:
S. Korean Court Hit for Its Base Repressive Action 
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Chongju District Court took such a fascist action as inflicting a penalty on a resident who protested against the unreasonable verdict of the judicial authorities while praising President Kim Il Sung, according to CBS of south Korea on Sunday.
					 In December last year the court turned down the appeal of a forwarding agent who had been sentenced to a prison term on charges of the violation of the "Security Law" for the mere reason that he praised the DPRK. Enraged at the court's verdict, the resident present among the public chanted "Long live Kim Il Sung!"
					
					 Taken aback by this, the puppet group arrested him and held a trial of him. It sentenced him to a prison term of one year and six months and suspension of qualifications of the same period on charges that he praised the north, posting on his website "literature benefiting the enemy" in a planned manner.
					
					 The south Korean group of traitors is becoming more desperate in its fascist crackdown to quell the reverence for the peerlessly great men growing deep among the south Korean people and their desire to achieve reunification through alliance with the north.

articles.title: Bangladeshi Figures Pay Respects for Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Bangladeshi Figures Pay Respects for Kim Il Sung 
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Bangladeshi figures visited the DPRK embassy in Dhaka on July 8, the 19th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, the president of the Bangladesh People's League, the chairman of the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy and the chairman of the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee laid a floral basket before portraits of Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
					
					 They expressed belief that the army and people of the DPRK would achieve greater success in building a thriving socialist nation and carrying out the cause of national reunification under the wise leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Meeting for Solidarity with Koreans Held in London
articles.content:
Meeting for Solidarity with Koreans Held in London
						
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- There took place a meeting for solidarity with the Korean people outside the U.S. embassy in London on June 25 to mark the beginning of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 Dermot Hudson, chairman of the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, said that the U.S. imperialists provoked the Korean war with an ambition to bring down the DPRK and hold hegemony over the world and committed brutal and inhuman atrocities unprecedented in the human history of war.
					
					 The Korean army and people turned out to defend the freedom and independence of the country, national sovereignty and gains of the revolution under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung and inflicted a shameful defeat on the U.S. imperialists, he said, and went on:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists never drew a lesson from the defeat in the Korean war but have steadily posed grave threats to the sovereignty and supreme interests of the DPRK with the war racket.
					
					 History proves that they are the provocateurs of the Korean war and a root cause of all sufferings and misfortune of the Korean nation.
					
					 After the meeting booklets disclosing the U.S. criminal atrocities during the war were handed out to people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Off Press in Cambodia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Off Press in Cambodia
 Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us March Forward Dynamically towards Final Victory, Holding Higher the Banner of Songun" was brought out in pamphlet by the Antri Miek Publishing House of Cambodia.
					 The work, a speech made by him at the parade for celebrating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung on April 15, Juche 101 (2012), says the 100-year history of Kim Il Sung's nation clearly proves the immutable truth that outstanding leaders assure the dignity and prosperity of the country and the nation.
					
					 It sets forth the tasks to be fulfilled to demonstrate the dignity of Songun Korea for all ages and successfully carry out the cause of building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 The releasing ceremony of the work was held at the publishing house on July 11.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre campos de construccion de nuevos hospitales
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre campos de construccion de nuevos hospitales
 Pyongyang, 17 de julio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio el dia 16 en el terreno el Hospital de Pediatria y el Hospital de Estomatologia en construccion.
					 El recorrio primero el campo de construccion del Hospital de Pediatria.
					
					 Mirando el panorama del campo, recibio el parte de los comandantes de la unidad encargada de la obra sobre el estado de construccion.
					
					 Dando vueltas por varios puntos, averiguo si la ejecucion de la obra marcha con calidad segun los requisitos del diseno.
					
					 Se mostro satisfecho de que los constructores militares hayan terminado en lo principal la edificacion de armadura del hospital en un corto tiempo y aceleraran ahora la construccion.
					
					 Acto seguido, visito el campo de construccion del Hospital de Estomatologia.
					
					 Pregunto como marcha la construccion y cuales son los problemas surgidos en la obra.
					
					 Finalizado el recorrido por los dos centros asistenciales, presento las tareas que se presentan en la construccion.
					
					 Lo importante en la construccion de dos hospitales es acelerar esas obras con calidad, acondicionarlos modernamente e impulsar desde ahora los preparativos para operarlos bien, enseno.
					
					 Subrayo que para situar los hospitales a las alturas del nuevo siglo, hay que disponerlos de equipos medicos sofisticados, incluyendo roentgen multiproposito, CT y aparato universal de tratamiento estomatologico.
					
					 Hace falta impulsar con prevision la dotacion de los equipos de prevencion, diagnostico y tratamiento de enfermedades y de fomento de salud publica y la preparacion de los muebles necesarios a la vida de los pacientes conforme a las caracteristicas y usos de los hospitales, instruyo.
					
					 Diciendo que no hay nada que escatimar para los habitantes y ninos, agrego que el partido se encargara de preparar los equipos medicos, los TV, los refrigeradores y otros efectos a ser instalados en los cuartos de enfermos.
					
					 Expreso la esperanza y conviccion de que los constructores y los funcionarios del sector correspondiente construiran magnificamente los dos hospitales hasta el dia de fundacion del PTC.
					
					 Le acompanaron en esta visita de orientacion Pak Pong Ju, Ri Jae Il, Ma Won Chun y Ho Hwan Chol.

articles.title: Prosperara Corea bajo la guia de Kim Jong Un, destacan periodicos
articles.content:
Prosperara Corea bajo la guia de Kim Jong Un, destacan periodicos
 Pyongyang, 17 de julio (ACNC) -- Los periodicos coreanos difundieron el dia 17 los editoriales dedicados al primer aniversario del otorgamiento al camarada Kim Jong Un del titulo de Mariscal de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					 El diario Rodong Sinmun subrayo que ese suceso fue una expresion de la confianza y fidelidad absolutas de todo el ejercito y pueblo de la RPDC al Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 El Mariscal cumplio en el maximo nivel la causa de eternidad de los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il, lo cual fue su proeza mas grande realizada en un ano transcurrido desde entonces, senala Rodong Sinmun y continua:
					
					 Gracias a su noble fidelidad, obligacion moral y dinamicas actividades, en la capitalina colina Mansu y por doquier del pais fueron levantadas las estatuas de bronce de los Generalisimos.
					
					 Se impulso energicamente la transformacion de toda la sociedad segun el kimilsungismo-kimjongilismo y se hizo intensa la lucha de todo el pueblo por materializar consecuentemente los legados de los Generalisimos.
					
					 Otra gran proeza del Mariscal es haber defendido la dignidad y la soberania del pais al conducir a la victoria el enfrentamiento con Estados Unidos bajo la bandera del Songun.
					
					 En un ano pasado, el estuvo en el largo camino de direccion mediante el Songun dando pruebas de su intransigente espiritu antiimperialista, impetu de aniquilar a los enemigos y extraordinaria estrategia y prevision militar.
					
					 Otra hazana reside en que el hizo abrir nueva era dorada en todos los dominios de la revolucion y la construccion y crear la heroica velocidad de marcha. 
					
					 Un ano pasado desde el otorgamiento del titulo de Mariscal fue una trayectoria orgullosa en que se avanzo segun la idea de el y se lograron victorias con su impetu.
					
					 Ademas, ha sido un trayecto en que bajo su direccion, fueron creados milagros e innovaciones sorprendentes con las inagotables fuerzas espirituales de todos los militares y habitantes.
					
					 Minju Joson enfatiza que la concesion del titulo de Mariscal a Kim Jong Un es una manifestacion de la conviccion y voluntad del ejercito y pueblo coreanos de llevar a feliz termino la causa revolucionaria del Juche iniciada en el monte Paektu bajo la direccion de ese General Insigne del Songun.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion de Mongolia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion de Mongolia
 Pyongyang, 17 de julio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium del Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio el dia 17 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con el asesor del presidente de Mongolia para la seguridad nacional y la politica exterior, Lundeg Purevsuren, y su comitiva que le hicieron una visita de cortesia.
					 En la ocasion, el huesped expreso su deseo de que bajo la destacada direccion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un, el pueblo coreano logre mayores exitos en la construccion de un Estado prospero socialista y el cumplimento de la causa de reunificacion de la patria.
					
					 Expuso la conviccion de que se ampliaran y se desarrollaran mas las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises.

articles.title: RPDC sufre danos por lluvias torrenciales
articles.content:
RPDC sufre danos por lluvias torrenciales
						
 Pyongyang, 17 de julio (ACNC) -- Del dia 9 al 16, cayeron muchas lluvias torrenciales en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					 Segun los datos sintetizados, cayeron en ese lapso 518mm de lluvia en la provincia de Kangwon, 483mm en la de Phyong-an del Sur, 428mm en la ciudad de Pyongyang, 359mm en la provincia de Hwanghae del Norte, 328mm en la ciudad de Nampho, 257mm en la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur, 253mm en la de Phyong-an del Norte, 189mm en la de Hamgyong del Sur y 137mm en la de Jagang.
					
					 Particularmente, las precipitaciones registradas desde las 21:00 del dia 14 hasta las 24:00 del dia 16 son: 344mm en la ciudad de Anju, 280mm en el distrito de Mundok, 253mm en la ciudad de Kaechon, 243mm en el distrito de Nyongbyon, 242mm en el distrito de Pakchon, 239mm en el distrito de Sepho, 231mm en el de Tongchang, 219mm en el de Unjon, 207mm en el de Chonma y 202mm en el de Sinyang.
					
					 Varias localidades sufrieron perdidas por la influencia del frente de mucha lluvia.
					
					 De las 18:00 del dia 13 a las 18:00 del dia 15, 4 personas perdieron sus vidas y una persona desaparecio.
					
					 Quedaron destruidos y anegados a escala nacional mas de 180 edificios de viviendas.
					
					 Fueron anegadas y enterradas mas de 820 hectareas de arrozales y tierra de secano en la provincia de Hwanghae del Norte.
					
					 Fueron destruidos las carreteras y puentes en Songchon, Yangdok y Pongsan entre otros distritos.

articles.title: Extranjeros en Corea visitan varios puntos de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Extranjeros en Corea visitan varios puntos de Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, 17 de julio (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 60o aniversario de la victoria del pueblo coreano en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, los representantes diplomaticos de varios paises, representantes de las organizaciones internacionales y otros miembros de embajadas y representaciones acreditadas en Corea visitaron el dia 17 la Fabrica de Alimentos Basicos de Pyongyang.
					 Los huespedes rindieron homenaje al Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il ante la pintura mural de mosaicos con sus imagenes sonrientes.
					
					 En la sala de presentacion del historial, escucharon las explicaciones sobre las proezas de direccion de los grandes hombres sin pares del monte Paektu y vieron una videocinta.
					
					 Luego, recorrieron varios puntos de la fabrica.
					
					 El embajador vietnamita Le Quang Ba dijo que el Mariscal Kim Jong Un hizo acondicionar magnificamente esa fabrica que contribuye a la mejora de vida del pueblo.
					
					 Acto seguido, ellos visitaron la Escuela Internacional de Futbol de Pyongyang y el Parque Deportivo del Pueblo de Rungna.
					
					 Los visitantes dejaron letras en el libro de visitas.
					
					 El embajador egipcio Iman Mostafa Abdou Ahmed escribio que pudo conocer bien que el Mariscal Kim Jong Un presta gran atencion al desarrollo del deporte del pais.
					
					 El jefe de la Oficina de Cooperacion Economica de Libia en Corea, Muhammad Mustafa escribio que el Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il dedicaron toda su vida para el pueblo y que el Mariscal Kim Jong Un presta profunda atencion a la mejora de vida del pueblo y al desarrollo del deporte del pais en acato al legado de ellos.
